description:
Software Control of Home Automation Systems

Last year I presented a talk on home automation at OSCON, focusing on the hardware aspects. This year my home automation talk will cover the software aspects of controlling home automation systems; topics include:

o  Software control of electrical devices in the home, e.g. lights, motors, appliances, bells
o  Detection of light conditions, e.g. dusk, dawn
o  Detection of motion
o  Collection of telephone caller-id information and its dissemination
o  Using a wireless remote to activate computer programs
o  Scheduling home automation tasks using cron
o  Monitoring activity and taking secondary actions
o  Writing scripts to simplify home automation tasks

Practical applications include turning off all the lights at night, summoning everyone for mealtime, and broadcasting caller-id information to all computers. The talk will cover the use of the ‘heyu’ open source home automation program. Examples will include the creation of ‘bash’-based stand-alone scripts, background daemons, and cron additions.
title: Software Control of Home Automation Systems
